title: Contributing to saros
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("NIFU-/saros", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

what: Connection to the Astronomical concept of Saros
title: saros_name
text: term “saros” also refers cyclical phenomenon astronomy known Saros cycle, represents period approximately 18 years, 11 days, 8 hours. one Saros cycle, Sun, Earth, Moon return approximately relative positions, leading similar eclipse. Cyclical occurrences: case R package, cyclical events relates surveys repeated annually biannually, astronomy, cyclical events refers recurring pattern eclipses. Consistency: saros R package aims maintain consistency reporting analysis across survey iterations, just astronomical Saros cycle represents predictable pattern occurrence solar lunar eclipses. Time-saving: saros R package designed automate streamline process summarizing reporting survey data, saving researchers time effort. Similarly, Saros cycle useful tool astronomers predict plan future eclipses, making easier study events without make complex calculations time.

title: Semi-Automatic Reporting of Ordinary Surveys
text: {saros} (Semi-Automatic Reporting Ordinary Surveys) R package designed handle repeating surveys within project occur annually biannually. aims automate process summarizing reporting survey data, helping researchers save time maintain consistency across survey iterations. Specifically, {saros} produces highly customizable figures, tables, analyses complex interactive reports batch possible dependent-independent relations possible interest.

code: --- params:     mesos_var: "f_uni"     mesos_group: "Uni of A" # This can be replaced in a command: `quarto render ch1.qmd -P mesos_group:'Uni of A'` --- library(saros) refine_chapter_overview(data = ex_survey,                         chapter_overview = ex_survey_ch_overview,                         chunk_templates = get_chunk_template_defaults(2),                         always_show_bi_for_indep = "x1_sex",                         hide_bi_entry_if_sig_above = .05) |>   draft_report(data = ex_survey,                prefix_heading_for_group = c(".variable_name_indep" = "---\n"),                auxiliary_variables = "f_uni",                serialized_format = "qs"                )

Built-types: Whereas names types can arbitrary, pattern pursued built-types. Prefix indicates dependent data type intended "cat" Categorical (ordinal nominal) data. "chr" Open ended responses character data. "int" Integer numeric data. Suffix indicates output "html" Interactive html, usually want Quarto, Quarto can usually convert formats needed "docx" However, Quarto's Pandoc's docx-support currently still limited, instance vector graphics converted raster graphics docx output. text: data data.frame/tibble srvyr-object (experimental) data.frame // required data used plotting. dep, indep Variable selections <tidyselect> // Default: NULL, meaning everything dep, nothing indep. Columns data. dep compulsory. type Kind output scalar<character> // default: "cat_plot_html" (optional) list registered types session, use get_makeme_types(). ... Dynamic dots <dynamic-dots> Arguments forwarded corresponding functions create elements. require_common_categories Check common categories scalar<logical> // default: TRUE (optional) Whether check items share common categories. crowd group(s) display results vector<character> // default: c("target", "others", "") (optional) Choose whether produce results target (mesos) group, others, , combinations . mesos_var Variable data indicating groups tailor reports scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) Column name data indicating groups mesos reports produced. mesos_group scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) String, target group. simplify_output scalar<logical> // default: TRUE TRUE, list output single output element return element , whereas list multiple elements return list. hide_for_crowd_if_all_na Hide variable output containing NA scalar<boolean> // default: TRUE Whether remove variables (particular useful mesos) values NA hide_for_crowd_if_valid_n_below Hide variable variable < n observations scalar<integer> // default: 0 Whether hide variable crowd variable contains fewer n observations (always ignoring NA). hide_for_crowd_if_category_k_below Hide variable < k categories scalar<integer> // default: 2 Whether hide variable crowd variable contains fewer k used categories (always ignoring NA). Defaults 2 unitary plot/table rarely informative. hide_for_crowd_if_category_n_below Hide variable category < n observations scalar<integer> // default: 0 Whether hide variable crowd variable contains category less n observations (ignoring NA) Cells 0 count considered usually problem anonymity. hide_for_crowd_if_cell_n_below Hide variable cell < n scalar<integer> // default: 0 Whether hide variable crowd combination dep-indep results cell less n observations (ignoring NA). Cells 0 count considered usually problem anonymity. hide_for_all_crowds_if_hidden_for_crowd Conditional hiding scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) Select one crowd output groups. selected, hide variable across crowd-outputs reason displayed hide_for_all_if_hidden_for_crowd. instance, say: crowd = c("target", "others"), hide_variable_if_all_na = TRUE, hide_for_all_if_hidden_for_crowd = "target" hide variables target others-outputs NA target-group. hide_indep_cat_for_all_crowds_if_hidden_for_crowd Conditionally hide independent categories scalar<logical> // default: FALSE hide_for_all_crowds_if_hidden_for_crowd specified, categories indep variable(s) hidden crowd exist crowds specified hide_for_all_crowds_if_hidden_for_crowd? useful e.g. indep academic disciplines, mesos_var institutions, specific institution interested seeing academic disciplines offer . add_n_to_dep_label, add_n_to_indep_label Add N= variable label scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) plots tables useful attach "N=" end label dependent /independent variable. Whether N N_valid depends showNA-setting. See also translations$add_n_to_dep_label_prefix, translations$add_n_to_dep_label_suffix, translations$add_n_to_indep_label_prefix, translations$add_n_to_indep_label_suffix. add_n_to_label Add N= variable label dep indep scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) plots tables useful attach "N=" end label. Whether N N_valid depends showNA-setting. See also translations$add_n_to_label_prefix translations$add_n_to_label_suffix. add_n_to_category Add N= category scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) plots tables useful attach "N=" end category. likely produce range across variables, hence infix (comma) minimum maximum can specified. Whether N N_valid depends showNA-setting. See also translations$add_n_to_category_prefix, translations$add_n_to_category_infix, translations$add_n_to_category_suffix. totals Include totals scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) Whether include totals output. categories_treated_as_na NA categories vector<character> // default: NULL (optional) Categories treated NA. label_separator separate main question sub-question scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) Separator main question sub-question. error_on_duplicates Error warn duplicate labels scalar<logical> // default: TRUE (optional) Whether abort (TRUE) warn (FALSE) label (suffix) used across multiple variables. showNA Show NA categories vector<character> // default: c("ifany", "always", "never") (optional) Choose whether show NA categories results. data_label Data label scalar<character> // default: "proportion" (optional) One "proportion", "percentage", "percentage_bare", "count", "mean", "median". data_label_position Data label position scalar<character> // default: "center" (optional) Position data labels bars. One "center" (middle bar), "bottom" (bottom inside bar), "top" (top inside bar), "" (bar outside). html_interactive Toggle interactive plot scalar<logical> // default: TRUE (optional) Whether plot interactive (ggiraph) static (ggplot2). hide_axis_text_if_single_variable Hide y-axis text just single variable scalar<boolean> // default: FALSE (optional) Whether hide text y-axis label just single variable. hide_label_if_prop_below Hide label threshold scalar<numeric> // default: NULL (optional) Whether hide label value. inverse Flag swap x-axis faceting scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) TRUE, swaps x-axis faceting. vertical Display plot vertically scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) TRUE, display plot vertically. digits Decimal places scalar<integer> // default: 0L (optional) Number decimal places. data_label_decimal_symbol Decimal symbol scalar<character> // default: "." (optional) Decimal marker, might prefer comma ',' something else entirely. x_axis_label_width, strip_width Label width x-axis strip texts plots scalar<integer> // default: 20 (optional) Width labels used categorical column names x-axis texts strip texts. sort_by sort output vector<character> // default: NULL (optional) Sort output (collapse requested). using indep-argument, sorting differs ordered factors unordered factors: Ordering ordered factors always respected output (levels define base order). Unordered factors reordered sort_by. Currently, works best single dep. NULL sorting. ".top" proportion highest category available variable. ".upper" sum proportions categories middle category. ".mid_upper" sum proportions categories including middle category. ".mid_lower" sum proportions categories including middle category. ".lower" sum proportions categories middle category. ".bottom" proportions lowest category available variable. ".variable_label" Sort variable labels. ".variable_name" Sort variable names. ".variable_position" Sort variable position supplied data frame. ".by_group" groups argument. character() Character vector category labels sum together. descend Sorting order scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) Reverse sorting sort_by figures tables. Works ordered unordered factors - ordered factors, reverses display order preserving inherent level ordering. See arrange_section_by sorting report sections. labels_always_at_top, labels_always_at_bottom Top/bottom variables vector<character> // default: NULL (optional) Column names data always placed top bottom figures/tables. table_wide Pivot table wider scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) Whether pivot table wider. table_main_question_as_header Table main question header scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) Whether include main question header table. n_categories_limit Limit cat_table_ wide format scalar<integer> // default: 12 (optional) number categories categorical variable, cat_table_* long format instead wide format. translations Localize output list<character> list translations name code value translation. See examples. plot_height DOCX-setting scalar<numeric> // default: 12 (optional) DOCX plots need height, currently set easily Quarto chunk option. colour_palette Colour palette vector<character> // default: NULL (optional) Must contain least number unique values (including missing) data set. colour_2nd_binary_cat Colour second binary category scalar<character> // default: "#ffffff" (optional) Colour second category binary variables. Often useful hide . colour_na Colour NA category scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) Colour single string NA values, showNA "ifany" "always". main_font_size, label_font_size, strip_font_size, legend_font_size Font sizes scalar<integer> // default: 6 (optional) DOCX-OUTPUT. output adjusted using e.g. ggplot2::theme() set global theme (ggplot2::set_theme()). Font sizes general text (6), data label text (3), strip text (6) legend text (6). font_family Font family scalar<character> // default: "sans" (optional) Word font family. See officer::fp_text. path Output path DOCX scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) Path save docx-output. docx_template Filename rdocx object scalar<character>|<rdocx>-object // default: NULL (optional) Can either valid character path reference Word file, existing rdocx-object memory.

what: saros: Semi-Automatic Reporting of Ordinary Surveys — saros-package
title: saros: Semi-Automatic Reporting of Ordinary Surveys — saros-package
text: Offers systematic way conditional reporting figures tables many (bivariate combinations ) variables, typically survey data. Contains interactive 'ggiraph'-based (https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=ggiraph) plotting functions data frame-based summary tables (bivariate significance tests, frequencies/proportions, unique open ended responses, etc) many arguments customization, extensions possible. Uses global options() system neatly reducing redundant code. Also contains tools immediate saving objects returning hashed link object, useful creating download links high resolution images upon rendering 'Quarto'. Suitable highly customized reports, primarily intended survey research.

See also translations$add_n_to_label_prefix translations$add_n_to_label_suffix. add_n_to_category Add N= category scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) plots tables useful attach "N=" end category. likely produce range across variables, hence infix (comma) minimum maximum can specified. Whether N N_valid depends showNA-setting. See also translations$add_n_to_category_prefix, translations$add_n_to_category_infix, translations$add_n_to_category_suffix. hide_label_if_prop_below Hide label threshold scalar<numeric> // default: NULL (optional) Whether hide label value. data_label_decimal_symbol Decimal symbol scalar<character> // default: "." (optional) Decimal marker, might prefer comma ',' something else entirely. categories_treated_as_na NA categories vector<character> // default: NULL (optional) Categories treated NA. label_separator separate main question sub-question scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) Separator main question sub-question. descend Sorting order scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) Reverse sorting sort_by figures tables. Works ordered unordered factors - ordered factors, reverses display order preserving inherent level ordering. See arrange_section_by sorting report sections. labels_always_at_top, labels_always_at_bottom Top/bottom variables vector<character> // default: NULL (optional) Column names data always placed top bottom figures/tables. translations Localize output list<character> list translations name code value translation. See examples. call Internal call obj:<call> // Default: rlang::caller_env() (optional) absolute relative folderpaths required, strings.

title: saros 1.6.0
text: Using air consistent code formatting Feature: makeme() new output type = “int_plot_html” interactive interval plots violin box plots Feature: Added support data_label = "mean" data_label = "median" makeme() type = "cat_*_html" outputs (addresses issue #460) Feature: Added data_label_position argument makeme() allowing data labels positioned “center”, “bottom”, “top”, “” bars categorical plots (addresses issue #365) Feature: Added .onUnload() function clean global options package unloaded, preventing option pollution user’s R session Feature: Enhanced chr_table_html support multiple independent variables displaying background context open-ended text responses. Now allows researchers show demographic contextual information alongside character survey responses Major change: makeme() returns empty data.frame instead NULL plot table can created, simplifying downstream code (e.g. gt::gt() fails served NULL). Major change: Resolved issue #372 - descend parameter now works correctly ordered factors preserving inherent level ordering. Ordered factors maintain natural order base, descend can reverse display order Refactor: Substantially modularized internal implementation makeme() focused helper functions (argument setup, crowd processing, output assembly, validation). Improves readability, testability (+ new helper tests), robustness without changing public API (closes #368) Enhancement: Completely rewrote .spread algorithm subset_vector() better spread maximization using evenly spaced positions Updated documentation reference ggplot2::theme_set() ggplot2::set_theme() due ggplot 4.0.0. Fix: CRITICAL - Resolved bug makeme() combinations valid factor variables -NA factor variables incorrectly threw “mix categorical continuous variables” error. Variable type checking now uses filtered variable lists instead original lists, preventing premature type validation errors Fix: Corrected double NA check logic check_bool() function - removed redundant condition made validation always pass NA values Fix: Improved NULL NA handling glue_together_range() prevent edge case failures empty invalid data ranges Fix: Resolved issue #464 - makeme() failures sigtest_table dep indep variables overlap. Now automatically excludes indep variables dep selection prevent conflicts Fix: Improved robustness check_no_duplicated_label_suffix() handle empty data frames missing columns gracefully Fix: Enhanced check_sort_by() validation properly handle empty character vectors clear error messages Fix: Improved keep_subitem() handle character inputs use factor levels better NA handling Fix: Simplified arrange_table_data() sorting logic better reliability Enhancement: PERFORMANCE - Optimized makeme() examples 73.8% faster execution (6.6s → 1.7s total). Reduced variable counts crowd configurations maintaining educational value. Examples now run efficiently R package documentation CRAN checks Enhancement: Updated fig_height_h_barchart2() example consistency optimized examples Dev: Added comprehensive test coverage utility validation functions Dev: Added comprehensive unit tests makeme() variable type checking edge cases including -NA variables, multiple scenarios, disabled filtering Dev: Added VS Code configuration improved development experience Dev: Added survey package Suggests enhanced testing capabilities Dev: Updated build ignore patterns coverage reports library files
